title: Can't import bookmarks from Chrome into Firefox
content:
FIrefox won't install the bookmarks folder I exported from Chrome. Perhaps the reason is they are a lot (1000+ bookmarks), but I still hope it could work, because I want to switch to Firefox, but won't be able to do this if I can't transfer all my bookmarks.

There are basically two methods. One is the automatic method that is provided during the installation of Firefox. It transferred all the other stuff from Chrome but not my bookmarks. The other is the manual installation in which you download or export the bookmarks from Chrome in a HTML file and then import them in the Firefox bookmark manager. Nothing happens.

Is there any other or better way I can import my Chrome bookmarks? Thanks!!!

title: External links and links from applications not behaving as expected.
content:
Firefox version : 141.0 (64-bit) in openSuse Tumbleweed.

This is a fresh install of everything because it's a new machine.

I used Firefox sync because we can't do the old thing of importing a pre-existing profile - it doesn't do what it says it should...

There are two behaviours in my old setup which no longer work, but which are related.

1. If I open a link in Thunderbird it should, if an instance of Firefox is already running, open in a new tab of the existing Firefox window. It doesn't. It opens a new window.

2. If I click on an external link to a site (ie one that points to another site) it should open in another tab. It doesn't.

I have tried the solutions suggested on this site and they don't work.

title: Firefox 141.0 slow and glitchy on dynamic sites, 140.x and other browsers not affected
content:
Since updating to Firefox 141.0 (Win11), I've had issues with performance and on-screen behaviour of dynamic web pages/sites. The problems do not manifest on Chrome, or on a reinstalled version of Fx 140.0.4 on the same computer running at the same time (and with copy of original profile's data files, extensions etc.).

The manifesting problems:

  • Screen pointer rapidly switching between standard arrow pointer, mouse with index finger (clickable link) and serifed-style insertion bar, even when positioned on a part of the page that is not a link or a text box. Video (MP4, <1MB) showing behaviour at https://imgur.com/a/absjTh4.
  • Browser intermittently fails to respond to browser actions (mouse clicks, keyboard entry)
  • Small increase in browser CPU usage

Problem is worse if general CPU usage is already high. (I run BOINC on 10 of 12 CPU cores; problem is not quite as bad if I reduce BOINC to 6 cores and isn't observed when BOINC is temporarily suspended from computing.) The problem happens on dynamic pages (e.g. gmail.com, boardgamearena.com/lobby) but doesn't seem to happen on static pages.

The fact that I can see the problem occurring on Fx 141 but have Fx 140.0.4 working fine at the same time on the same page, suggests that this is a Fx 141 issue. Regular malware scanner and an alternate found no issues.

Happy to do more diagnostic testing if it's helpful.
creator: paddles1

title: Extreme clean re-installation
content:
How do I reinstall Firefox FROM SCRATCH when older settings (but not the .exe itself) is still on a Windows PC? Will deleting all entries in Windows Registry fix it?

Background is that I switched Sata cables for some hard drives (for an unrelated experiment), of which one contained the Firefox installation on D:. Then I ran Firefox, and somehow it seemed to work and I also was promted to install an update which I did. After some days I switched back Sata cables. Now I cannot uninstall old instances of Firefox that I can see in Win Settings -> Apps. Worse, I cannot install Firefox anywhere AND also make Firefox running without a crash after a few seconds. To remove all info in registry and hard drives might be the way to solve this?
creator: hieronymus

title: Certificado digital no funciona
content:
¡Hola! Desde hace ya unos meses, no me funciona el certificado digital que proporciona la Administración para iniciar sesión en cualquier página, como por ejemplo, la sede electrónica de la Agencia Tributaria. Al darle, ocurre una de dos cosas: o la página se queda cargando indefinidamente y el pop-up del certificado nunca sale, o sale, lo selecciono... y vuelve a quedarse cargando indefinidamente. Con otros navegadores sí funciona. Ya he probado a borrar cookies y datos de la página, desactivar cualquier extensión, reinstalar el certificado... Pero nada.

Por otro lado, en la versión móvil del navegador pasa algo parecido: al seleccionarlo, la primera vez siempre me da error, pero si vuelvo a intentar iniciar sesión, ya me deja. Espero que podáis ayudarme, muchas gracias y perdón por las molestias.
creator: andreslpo06

title: Problemi di utilizzo corsi di formazione on line
content: Nel fruire della formazione on line erogata dal MEF-REVISORI LEGALI laddove viene richiesto in un modulo del corso di dover obbligatoriamente aprire/visionare delle schede/card di approfondimento pur vedendole correttamente ed integralmente non viene consentito l'accesso al modulo successivo e quindi di blocca la visione del corso di formazione. L'assistenza tecnica del MEF da me all'uopo contattata attribuisce questa problematica alle impostazioni del Browser (???) o alla presenza di un server proxy o all'antivirus bloccante sul mio sistema. Ho provato nelle impostazioni di FIREFOX a rimuvere i blocchi presenti in protezione/sicurezza ma nessun rirultato utile ai fini dell'utile prosecuzione dei corsi di formazione on line impartiti dal Ministero dell'economia e Finanze. Se vi fossero dei blocchi di script che impediscono il corretto funzionamento del corso come si eliminano? Grz

title: 修改了firefox的默认下载目录,现在firefox在打开setting的时候自动创建Downloads
content: 我的系统和firefox版本如图, 我的firefox配置 user_pref("browser.download.dir", "/home/thsea/dls"); user_pref("browser.download.folderList", 2); 另外我在.profile 中设置了 XDG_DOWNLOADS_DIR=/home/thsea/dls 然后就遇到了这个问题,只要一打开firefox的setting firefox就会自动在家目录创建Downloads这个默认文件夹 但是我明明已经配置了其他的了啊,我看源码,它是会先检查用户配置,失败才会创建这个默认的啊. 所以我就搞不懂问题出在哪里,只好求助你们

title: Google Search reCaptcha
content:
128.13.0esr This is probably a huge long shot I know, because every forum etc on the internet has nothing that ever helps with this, but as it only happens in FF I thought it was worth a try.

Yesterday I changed my Privacy settings to 'delete cookies when FF is closed' and added a few exceptions. Then this Google Search reCaptcha thing started. Changed it back to what it was, basically the default setting there, but it was still happening. It only happens in FF [doesn't happen with Edge] and only on one pc, all other pc's and phones in the house are fine [all using the same network, router etc]. So I uninstalled FF altogether, reinstalled it...this thing was still happening regardless of what settings I use re cookies etc. If I actually complete the super annoying reCaptcha it goes away for about 1 or 2 searches, then comes back.

If I'm signed in to a Google account it doesn't happen.

I even did a fresh Windows install [which actually fixed this the other time this was happening about 6 months ago] but that didn't fix it this time. There is no malware, no VPN, no extensions that I haven't been using for years. Nothing that could ever possibly be considered 'bot-like' behaviour.

Thanks

I have restarted. Recently updated, and lost profile, but recovered it, but lost all my open windows & tabs, so now I have only 5 windows open. Seems to be nothing to do with if a window is minimized (OSX) or not. Needs a better mechanism to save open windows & tabs along with profile data.

title: Hidden ad tabs - Why is this allowed?
content:
I did some research recently on some travel sites.

Today, while trying to research which tab was doing DNS queries to SnapChat (which I never use) I learned about `about:processes`. I found 5 "hidden" tabs from various travel sites (some of which I never visited) running in the background. I did not explicitly hide any tabs.

WHY IS IT ALLOWED FOR SITES TO KEEP OPEN HIDDEN TABS AT ALL WITHOUT TELLING ME ABOUT IT?

This is not conducive to trusting Mozilla.
creator: jhgarrison
